meanings.definition: To place in contrast or opposition.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys counterposing different colors in her artwork.
meanings.sent2: The artist is counterposing light and dark shades in the painting.
meanings.sent3: The chef counterposed sweet and savory flavors in the dish.
meanings.sent4: His actions counterpose his words, creating confusion.
meanings.sent5: The author skillfully counterposed the protagonist's virtues and flaws.

meanings.definition: To set in opposition or contrast.
meanings.sent1: The debate team is counterposing two different arguments.
meanings.sent2: The politician is counterposing his opponent's views.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully counterpose their favorite colors.
meanings.sent4: The movie cleverly counterposes reality and fantasy.
meanings.sent5: The teacher counterposed two conflicting historical accounts.

meanings.definition: To juxtapose in order to show differences.
meanings.sent1: The presentation counterposes the advantages and disadvantages of each option.
meanings.sent2: The article counterposes the opinions of experts in the field.
meanings.sent3: The comedian humorously counterposed two unlikely scenarios.
meanings.sent4: The photographer counterposed the old and new architecture in the city.
meanings.sent5: The documentary counterposed the traditional and modern ways of life.
